intro: Dryandra echinata, commonly known as the black dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive, cone-shaped inflorescences and leathery, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. It is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a notable species in the region's flora.
